questions.clue: This massive amphitheater in Rome could hold up to 80,000 spectators and was used for gladiatorial contests.
Known as the 'Lost City of the Incas,' this site in Peru sits atop the Andes mountains.
This archaeological site in England is famous for its large standing stones arranged in a circular layout.
Located in modern-day Turkey, this ancient city was famously excavated by Heinrich Schliemann in the 19th century.
Discovered in 1947, these ancient manuscripts were found in caves near the Dead Sea.
In 'Pride and Prejudice,' this character begins with, 'It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.'
This novel opens with the line, 'Call me Ishmael.'
'It was the best of times, it was the worst of times,' begins this novel set during the French Revolution.
This dystopian novel starts with 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'
The line, 'All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way,' begins this Russian classic.
This fundamental particle of light is also a quantum of electromagnetic radiation.
This principle states that certain pairs of physical properties cannot be simultaneously known to arbitrary precision.
In quantum mechanics, this term describes the phenomenon where particles exist in multiple states at once until observed.
This famous thought experiment involves a cat that is simultaneously alive and dead until observed.
This concept describes particles instantaneously affecting each other, regardless of distance, when entangled.
This Mexican street food consists of a tortilla filled with meat, cheese, or beans, often topped with salsa.
A popular savory snack from India, these are deep-fried pastries stuffed with spiced potatoes, peas, or meat.
Originating from Japan, this dish consists of grilled octopus balls traditionally topped with mayonnaise and bonito flakes.
In Turkey, this street food is a seasoned meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, commonly served in a pita.
This popular street food from Thailand features stir-fried noodles with eggs, tofu, and shrimp, seasoned with tamarind paste.
In 1911, this iconic painting by Leonardo da Vinci was stolen from the Louvre by an Italian handyman.
In 1990, 13 pieces valued at $500 million were stolen from this Boston institution, making it the largest art theft in history.
This Norwegian artist's painting 'The Scream' was stolen in 1994 on the same day as the Winter Olympics opening ceremony in Lillehammer.
In 2003, two Van Gogh paintings were stolen from this Dutch museum, named after the artist himself.
In 2012, paintings by artists like Picasso and Matisse were stolen from the Kunsthal Museum in this European city, which is known for its port.

final.clue: This 19th-century novel, inspired by the author's experiences on an island in the South Pacific, includes a group of sailors marooned on a mysterious island.
